msContents.summary: A document dealing with a sale of cultivated plots. The seller and ﬁrst subscriber was almost certainly the archdeacon Theodoros, son of Obodianos, while the second subscriber, Flavius Valens, must have been the buyer.

msItemStruct.note: Written transversa charta across the ﬁbers. Left margin 1.5–2.0 cm and bottom margin ca. 23 cm. The main hand is a professional scribal upright cursive. The ﬁrst subscription is written in a more slanting and irregular cursive. The second subscription belongs to Flavius Valens. evidently the buyer, begins in l. 110 (fr. A12). This hand continues until a different, upright hand, probably belonging to the first witness appears.
